definition: to patrol/to make a tour/to inspect/to scan with one's eyes
to patrol/to make one's rounds/classifier for rounds of drinks
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]

sentences.english: Well, you snooped around my house, and went through my stuff.
sentences.chinese: 你巡视我的屋子还检查我的东西。

sentences.english: Stolte looks around the room and sees the bucket on the floor.
sentences.chinese: Stolte在室内巡视了一番，看见在地上有个桶。

sentences.english: Herve, a European-division chief is touring Linda's division.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲分公司的主管贺福正在巡视琳达的部门。

sentences.english: Special teams will be sent occasionally to patrol at major oil and chemical ports.
sentences.chinese: 政府将不定期地安排特派团巡视主要的石油化学港口。

sentences.english: At the same time, the provincial hospital entrance examination each of the sites will send inspectors.
sentences.chinese: 同时，省招生考试院将向每一个考点派出巡视员。

sentences.english: After the banquet, Mr Feng wide failed to catch people MaiDaNian patrol bird cage.
sentences.chinese: 冯正宽没能抓到人，宴会结束后麦大年巡视雀笼。

sentences.english: Ministry of Health inspectors Liu attended the meeting and made an important speech.
sentences.chinese: 省卫生厅巡视员刘可出席会议并做重要讲话。

sentences.english: Make random patrols and remain in radio contact with the OOW.
sentences.chinese: 巡视路线不固定，并与值班驾驶员保持无线电联络。

sentences.english: We should reform and improve the system of Party discipline inspection and introduce and improve the system of inspection tours.
sentences.chinese: 改革和完善党的纪律检查体制，建立和完善巡视制度。

sentences.english: MIKE: Well, you snooped around my house, and went through my stuff.
sentences.chinese: 你巡视我的屋子还检查我的东西。

sentences.english: The night watchman makes his rounds every hour.
sentences.chinese: 值夜班的人每个小时都会到各处巡视一次。

sentences.english: After an afternoon inspection, inspection teams have been consolidated.
sentences.chinese: 经过一下午的检查，巡视组进行了汇总。

sentences.english: He even made a late-night tour with a few deputy mayors and reporters to see it for himself.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至还在深夜里跟几个副市长和记者们亲自去巡视。

sentences.english: President Bush was visiting a primary school and he visited one of the classes.
sentences.chinese: 布殊总统正在巡视某小学，巡到一个课室。

sentences.english: She wants employees to share the chore of leading tours of the office each week.
sentences.chinese: 她希望员工每星期分担办公室重要巡视的杂事。

sentences.english: Determining the responsibility zone, often arranged and visits to various area of responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 确定各责任区，时常安排和巡视各责任区域。

definition: to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
(of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
to patrol/to perambulate/to travel around within an area
to warn/to alert/to be on the alert/to stand guard/sentinel
variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
to tidy up/to mop up/a sweep (against crime)
to investigate/to observe/to scout/to seek out and examine/to explore
